result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Demont Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or combination of both.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gregory Demont Anderson in court.  Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for Gregory Demont Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Information.  Agreement reached.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Def acknowledges prior offense.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
(Copy mailed to Def and Def Atty)
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gregory Demont Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Gregory Demont Anderson. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.  Def does not qualify for SPD and req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Van Dam.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $100 per month commencing 8-15-22.  Court sets $500 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
